From: mgr. Ansbel LBREAK To: all staff LBREAK subject: improper storage of synth accessories LBREAK
To the responsible parties, LBREAK
Please note that when not attached to the Omnico synthetic predator gynoid the class II genital attachment is to be stored safely in sub-level 2 storage area B. Furthermore they're to be contained in a type-7 cargo box compliant with the standards for the preservation of flexible synth material. LBREAK
It is not in fact appropriate to store them in an open topped plastic document tray perched precariously atop the door to Orrena's office. I should warn you that should you persist I will be forced to make some HR decisions. LBREAK
I also should remind you that unlike our products I don't need an attachment for that, and I have space on my shelf for a 2 gallon jug. LBREAK
-Ansbel. LBREAK

From: Reshi LBREAK To: T. Velas LBREAK subject: dodgy units? LBREAK
Is it just me or are the latest batch of synths from head office kinda off. I can't put my finger on it, but something about the way they talk and look at me is freaking me out. Reminds me a tad too much of my last girlfriend, or the boss for that matter.

From: T. Velas LBREAK To: Reshi LBREAK subject: RE dodgy units LBREAK
It's probably just a new personality routine. Some gals like that kinda thing. Reset to the standard, though maybe you'd prefer some alone time with one if you're thinking too much of your last steady. Safer'n' asking the boss.

From: Reshi LBREAK To: T. Velas LBREAK subject: why build an omnico boutique out here? LBREAK
I don't get it. We're setup in the ass end of nowhere. I mean, I get that we're technically on a trade route. But how many ships have passed by since I came here? And how many fewer bought any synths.

From: T. Velas LBREAK To: Reshi LBREAK subject: RE why build an omnico boutique out here? LBREAK
Passing trade is down. But you're right it was never really high to begin with. I think the computer at head office figured this was one of the few unexploited market areas. I don't pretend to understand how it works, but it beats the old board of directors, trust me on this.

From: mgr. Ansbel LBREAK to: all LBREAK subject: missing ship LBREAK
As you all know the ship from head office is now overdue. I'm keeping the comm open to try and flag down passing traffic to pass on a message of inquiry to head office but so far interstellar traffic appears to have taken a nose dive. It is however nothing to worry about, our stock and supplies will last a considerable amount of time. Especially with the lack of passing customers.

From: T. Velas LBREAK To: all LBREAK subject: help! LBREAK
Someone locked me into testing with one and it's not stopping. I'm starting to get really sore..this isn't funny.

From: mgr. Asbel LBREAK to: all LBREAK RE: preventing accidents LBREAK
I'm going to presume the recent glitches involving the synth safeties are down to maintenance or defects rather than actual foul play for the time being. However it has become clear I need a contingency in place unless I want to explain to head office how I'm down half the staff due to the synths getting gurgle happy. As such I've pulled some strings to get us a reformation tube. It'll be locked in the back of the storage level unless the main computer detects synth's without their safeties. This is to stop you lot using it recreationally which I know you would do, and probably still will do despite my best efforts. Just remember I can blank patterns and I have a space on my shelf.

From: mgr. Asbel LBREAK to: all LBREAK RE: reprogramming synths LBREAK
I'm addressing this to all rather than the specific person responsible, and yes, i know exactly who you are. No one else shares your taste in vids and the sooner you realize that the better. Nevertheless it must be stated that despite the lack of traffic here it is not permitted to attempt to modify proprietory omnico software running on the synth units as a way to pass the time. Not only is it meddling with company policy, not only are none of you properly certified, but having the synths randomly spouting lines of dialogue from that inane show is insufferable. Revert them to factory settings and do not attempt this chicanery again.

From: mgr. Asbel LBREAK to: all LBREAK RE: do not open untrusted attachments! LBREAK
I should not have to go over basic IT policy but I will reiterate for those of you who must of spent the job interview under HR's desk instead of in front of it. Do not open attachments from any address other than a confirmed Omnico account. This runs the risk of allowing malware and viruses to infilitrate the network here, and I remind you that the synths have a wireless connection to the network and non omnico approved code has been known to cause them to act in an erratic or unsafe fashion.
